Package net.happybrackets.device.sensors

Class AccelerometerListener

java.lang.Object
net.happybrackets.device.sensors.AccelerometerListener
public abstract class AccelerometerListener
extends java.lang.Object
Creates an accelerometer listener. User needs to override abstract method sensorUpdate

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    AccelerometerListener​(HB hb)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    float scaleValue​(double sensor_value, double scaled_min, double scaled_max)
    Scale the values based on a maximum and minimum sensor value of 1 / -1 The value can be greater than scaled_min and scaled_max if sensor_value is greater than abs(1) ((scaled_max - scaled_min) * (sensor_value - sensor_min)) / (sensor_max - sensor_min) + scaled_min;
    abstract void sensorUpdated​(float x_val, float y_val, float z_val)
    Sensor has been updated
    void setRounding​(int resolution)
    Set the resolution for all three axis to the number of decimal places set by resolution.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • AccelerometerListener

      public AccelerometerListener​(HB hb)

  • Method Details

    • setRounding

      public void setRounding​(int resolution)
      Set the resolution for all three axis to the number of decimal places set by resolution. A value of -1 will remove rounding
      Parameters:
      resolution - the number of decimal places to round to. -1 will be no rounding

    • scaleValue

      public float scaleValue​(double sensor_value, double scaled_min, double scaled_max)
      Scale the values based on a maximum and minimum sensor value of 1 / -1 The value can be greater than scaled_min and scaled_max if sensor_value is greater than abs(1) ((scaled_max - scaled_min) * (sensor_value - sensor_min)) / (sensor_max - sensor_min) + scaled_min;
      Parameters:
      scaled_min - The value we want our standard minimum sensor value to become
      sensor_value - The actual value of our sensor
      scaled_max - The value we want our standard maximum sensor value to become
      Returns:
      the value scaled

    • sensorUpdated

      public abstract void sensorUpdated​(float x_val, float y_val, float z_val)
      Sensor has been updated
      Parameters:
      x_val - x value of accelerometer
      y_val - y value of accelerometer
      z_val - z value of accelerometer
